translation: A ten-fascicle translation of the Sutra of the Good Years (a sutra of the Samādhi of the Good Years and also known as the Sutra of the Concentration of the Good Years) by Rāsch in the Free and Easy Garden of Chang'an in the fourth year of the Later Qin Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD).
The above five sūtras were translated separately from the same text.

source_sentence: 海龍王經一部四卷(第一譯或三卷)右西晉太康六年竺法護譯。
translation: Sutra of the Sea Dragon King, a four-volume work (the first translation or three volumes) translated by Zhu Fahou in the sixth year of Tai Kang in the Western Jin Dynasty.
It was translated by Zhu Fashio in the sixth year of Tai Kang in the Western Jin Dynasty.

source_sentence: 新海龍王經一部四卷(第二譯八十五紙)右北涼玄始七年曇無讖於姑臧譯。
translation: A four-fascicle translation of the New Sea Dragon King Sutra (second translation, 85 pages) translated by Dharmakṣema in Guzang in the seventh year of Xuanzhi's reign in Northern Liang.
It was translated in Guzang in the seventh year of Xuanzhi's reign in Northern Liang.
The above two scriptures have the same text and different translations.

source_sentence: 大周刊定眾經目錄卷第四
translation: Dazhou dingzong jing mulu, vol. 4
